prs.title: set wormhole address in solana binary by patching it, to enable other SVM chains to work with the CLI
prs.truncated_body:
From @kcsongor in commit e43c778

"cli: set wormhole address in solana binary by patching it
The problem: solana binaries contain program addresses embedded into
them. Specifically, NTT includes the address of the Wormhole program
it's linked against. Which Wormhole address to include is controlled via
feature flags in the wormhole-anchor-sdk crate, which supports one of
mainnet, devnet, an

commits.message:
cli: set wormhole address in solana binary by patching it

The problem: solana binaries contain program addresses embedded into
them. Specifically, NTT includes the address of the Wormhole program
it's linked against. Which Wormhole address to include is controlled via
feature flags in the wormhole-anchor-sdk crate, which supports one of
mainnet, devnet, and localhost. For other SVM chains, like Fogo, we
can't build this binary correctly, because there is no way to tell it
which core address to use.

One solution is to roll out an updated version of the
wormhole-anchor-sdk, which allows setting the Wormhole address via an
environment variable. That is likely the prudent solution, but it will
need to be backported to older NTT versions (in case a Fogo deployer
wants to deploy, say, 3.0.0, instead of the main HEAD).

Another solution, which we adopt in this commit, is simply patching the
binary. In other words: compile the binary with the solana flag, then
replace the solana address with the desired address. This seems to work
just fine, there is no checksum signing on the binaries or anything. It
also makes compilation a bit faster, because we don't need to recompile
anything between different targets.

Not sure if we should keep this, but will do for now.
only apply patch if the used chain is not solana

prs.title: chore: backport #18722 – remove CL_MEDIAN_CMD default from Dockerfile
prs.truncated_body:
Summary
Manual backport of #18722 to release/2.26.0. The original cherry-pick resulted in an empty commit, so the change has been applied directly.

What this does
Removes CL_MEDIAN_CMD=chainlink-feeds from the core Dockerfile. This avoids startup hangs on high-job-count nodes due to Loop port exhaustion.

Why
Leaving this default in place causes port contention issues in production nodes.

commits.message: Remove default for CL_MEDIAN_CMD env in Docker

prs.truncated_body:
### Overview

This PR reintroduces test improvements for both `L1StandardBridge` and `L1ERC721Bridge`, using a newly [revised prompt](https://www.notion.so/oplabs/Prompt-v0-7-0-237f153ee162809f9d2df76ee831bc34?source=copy_link). It replaces a previously closed PR that suffered from inconsistent and non-actionable security-focused outputs. The new prompt shifts focus toward deterministic and valu

commits.message:
refactor(test): enhance L1StandardBridge test coverage with fuzz tests and edge cases

- Add fuzz tests for depositETHTo with random recipients and amounts
- Add fuzz tests for depositERC20 with various amounts and gas limits
- Add fuzz tests for access control with random unauthorized addresses
- Add edge case test for depositERC20To with zero amount
- Fix naming convention from Unclassified to Uncategorized
- Improve test documentation with concise parameter descriptions

refactor(test): enhance L1ERC721Bridge test coverage with fuzz tests and function tests

  - Add L1ERC721Bridge_SuperchainConfig_Test and L1ERC721Bridge_Version_Test contracts
  - Add testFuzz_finalizeBridgeERC721_invalidCaller_reverts for access control testing
  - Add testFuzz_finalizeBridgeERC721_randomAddresses_succeeds with predeploy address constraints
  - Add testFuzz_bridgeERC721To_validRecipient_succeeds for recipient validation
  - Add testFuzz_bridgeERC721To_invalidLocalToken_reverts for token validation
  - Add testFuzz_bridgeERC721_variousGasLimits_succeeds with bounded gas limit testing
  - Ensure 100% function coverage for superchainConfig() and version constant

fix(test): improve fuzz test constraints and remove redundant test
- Add constraint to ensure recipient address is not a contract in finalizeBridgeERC721 fuzz test
- Remove redundant fuzz test for zero address local token

prs.title: fix: remove wrong transition check in rollup-verifier
prs.truncated_body:
## 1. Purpose or design rationale of this PR

This transition check was supposed to initialize `prevL1MessageQueueHash` in EuclidV2, but it also got applied in Feynman, erroneously resetting the msg queue hash to zero, halting the rollup verification process.


## 2. PR title

Your PR title must follow [conventional commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/#summary) (as we are

# Changes

prs.title: Dockerfile: use multi-stage build optimisation
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Switched to Go 1.24‑alpine & Alpine 3.22; adopted a two‑stage build with SSH+cache mounts for go mod download and make build, then copied only the heimdalld binary and sh entrypoint into a minimal Alpine runtime (just certs, no Bash)—trimming the final image from hundreds of megabytes down to mere megabytes.

commits.message: feat: use multi-stage build in Dockerfile
chore: add bash in runtime image

prs.title: Dockerfile: use multi-stage build optimisation
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Switched to pinned Go 1.24 & Alpine 3.22; used a two‑stage BuildKit build with cache+SSH mounts to compile, then copied only the bor binary into a tiny Alpine runtime (just certs, no toolchain or Bash)—slashing the image from gigabytes to a few hundred megabytes.

This mirrors exactly what Geth’s Dockerfile does; see their approach here:
https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/

commits.message: feat: use multi-stage build in Dockerfile
chore: add bash in runtime image

prs.title: Fix tracer race condition
prs.truncated_body: Tracers have an unprotected string field `reason` that may be raced by the GetResult call and the timeout goroutine. This PR adds a mutex to protect against such race conditions. The timeout goroutine would not race with `ApplyTransactionWithEVM` because `ApplyTransactionWithEVM` doesn't access `reason`

prs.title: Optimization: CreateAccount only clears state if code hash exists
prs.truncated_body:
## Describe your changes and provide context
- when an account is created by evm, it needs to clear out any existing contract state
- clearing / deleting is expensive, so it makes sense to try to early-bail if possible
- the new logic only clears if the code hash key is set 

## Testing performed to validate your change
- perf analysis on pacific-1 rpc node
- fixed unit tests that were not

prs.title: Use legacy transaction decoder for historical height
prs.truncated_body:
## Describe your changes and provide context
In upgrade v6.0.6, we added a limit on how many recursions the transaction decoder can go through to prevent certain type of attacks. However this made historical blocks with transactions that were encoded with higher number of recursions unable to decode, so we reintroduced the old decoder only for usage on historical queries.

## Testing performed

commits.message: Use legacy tx decoder when appropriate

commits.message:
chore: revert mainnet/testnet to standard reth

Keep bera-reth only for local development as it's not production ready.
Mainnet and testnet targets continue using paradigmxyz/reth.

chore: add TODO comments for future bera-reth migration

Mark testnet and mainnet targets for future migration to bera-reth
when it becomes production ready.

fix: add absolute paths for bera-reth compatibility

Bera-reth requires absolute paths (/) in container due to path resolution
differences from standard reth. Standard reth works with relative paths
but bera-reth needs absolute paths to locate genesis files and data dirs.

Added documentation comment explaining this difference.

docs: document bera-reth path resolution bug

Added detailed comments explaining the root cause of the path resolution
issue in the custom reth fork at chainspec.rs:71. The parse_genesis function
uses shellexpand::full() but doesn't resolve relative paths to absolute paths,
causing failures in Docker containers when the working directory differs.

fix: revert to relative paths after bera-reth path resolution fix

The path resolution bug in bera-reth has been fixed in the latest
Docker image. This removes the need for absolute paths (/) in
container arguments, reverting all paths back to relative paths
to match the original reth configuration.

- Remove absolute path documentation comments
- Revert all Docker container paths to relative format
- Update to fixed bera-reth image tag

fix: update to bera-reth Docker image in testing.mk

Replace paradigmxyz/reth with berachain/bera-reth:nightly
to use the custom Berachain execution client that includes
path resolution fixes and Berachain-specific features.

chore: keep mainnet/testnet on standard reth with TODO

Revert mainnet and testnet reth configurations back to standard
paradigmxyz/reth with TODO comments for future bera-reth migration
once it's production ready for these networks.

feat: update prague1 activation timestamp and add berachain config

Update prague1 activation timestamp to 17446744073709551614 across
all genesis files except mainnet/testnet. Add berachain configuration
to additional genesis files for consistency.

fix: use bera-reth CLI commands in Kurtosis configuration

Update Kurtosis reth configuration to use bera-reth CLI commands
instead of standard reth commands for consistency with the
bera-reth Docker image.

feat: add berachain config to Kurtosis genesis templates

Add berachain configuration section with prague1 fork timing
to Kurtosis template files for consistent e2e testing setup.
enable prague1 at genesis in devnet (like electra1)
Merge branch 'testnet-mainnet-use-bera-reth' of github.com:berachain/beacon-kit into testnet-mainnet-use-bera-reth

## Summary

<!-- Briefly describe the changes -->

## Rationale

<!-- Why are these changes necessary? -->

## How has this been tested?

- [ ] Current tests cover my changes

prs.title: Support ref fields on contractevent structs
prs.truncated_body:
### What
  Add support for reference fields in `contractevent` structs, allowing borrowed values to be used in event fields.

  ### Why
  When publishing events that are made up of user-defined-types, this gives the developer the option of not copying the value into the event, instead referencing it wherever it is. This may present some optimisation opportunities over being forced to copy the

commits.message: support ref fields on contractevent structs

prs.title: Simplex QuorumCertificate and BLS aggregator
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Implements the simplex `QuorumCertificate`, `QCDeserializer` and `SignatureAggregator` interfaces. This allows simplex to parse, aggregate and verify quorum certificates(ex. finalizations and notarizations) during execution. 

## How this works

- Builds on top of the BLSVerifier to handle BLS signatures and public keys. 
- The bytes of a QC are serialized with

## Why this should be merged

The `./scripts/update_avalanchego_version.sh` script fails "randomly" in CI due to rate limits. Although the script attempts to use a GitHub token if available, it is never set in the `ci.yml` file.

prs.title: Remove custom `state.StateDB`
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

This allows `core.wrapStateDB` to be called with a `libevm` `state.StateDB` which is required for SAE.

## How this works


Currently there are 4 `StateDB` implementations:
1. libevm's `state.StateDB` implementation.
2. coreth's `state.StateDB` implementation.
3. coreth's `core.StateDbAP1` implementation.
4. coreth's `extstate.StateDB` implementation.

co

commits.message: Depend on correct version of libevm

prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Refactors `statesync` syncer to not expose the done channel. 

## How this works

Wraps channel to wait for either one of the contexts to finish.

## How this was tested

Existing UT, plus one extra for context cancellation

## Need to be documented?

No

## Need to update RELEASES.md?

No

commits.message: refactor: change sync interface to Wait()

prs.title: Feat: Remove unprofitable txs cache from the Sequencer
prs.truncated_body:
Remove the unprofitable tx cache from the Sequencer, since a better support to avoid retrying unprofitable txs is given by the penalization that decreases the score of the unprofitable tx.

CLI options to tune the cache are still present, but will have no effects, and will be removed in a future release.

### Checklist

* [ ] I wrote new tests for my new core changes.
* [ ] I have successfu

Feat: Remove unprofitable txs cache from the Sequencer

prs.title: chore(nano): remove deprecated get_balance
prs.truncated_body:
### Motivation

The `get_balance` syscall was deprecated in favor of the explicit methods `get_current_balance` and `get_balance_before_current_call`. This PR removes it.

Originally the task was to remove the `*_before_current_call` syscalls. But I gave more thought into it and I think it's good to keep them both, as it makes it clear for the user that there are different ways of interpreting

* bridge_in_amount_sats
